intro: Merianthera bullata, commonly known as the white ghostflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in desert or arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Merianthera bullata is a short-lived perennial that blooms in the spring and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
